chat: Discussion: [Bob]: I'm headed to Medbay now, anyone need to scan?
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "I'd love to join you in Medbay for scanning Bob - I noticed you were also in Cafeteria earlier with Charlie, Alice and Dave while we were all doing tasks there."

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since we've got several people confirming tasks in Cafeteria and now Bob and Erin doing visual scans in Medbay, I think we're making good progress on verifying each other's activities.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can vouch for Erin's statement - I saw her, Bob, Charlie, and Alice all completing tasks in Cafeteria, and I just finished the coffee maker task there myself.
Discussion: [System]: You have 4 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Great to hear that confirmation Dave, I appreciate you backing us up; let's all head to navigation together next for the next set of tasks.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I think we should pause our plans for navigation since I just discovered Alice's body in the Cafeteria - this must have happened right after we all split up from doing tasks together.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Given that I was in Cafeteria the whole time with everyone else, the killer must have struck in that brief moment when we started splitting up to head to different locations - I think we need to establish exactly when each person left and in what order.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: Since we were all doing tasks together and I stayed behind for the coffee maker, I think we need to focus on the exact moment when people started leaving - I distinctly remember Bob announcing Medbay first, then Erin following, while Charlie lingered a bit before leaving.
Discussion: [System]: You have 3 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It's strange that Dave remembers the order we left so clearly, wasn't he focused on the coffee maker?

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I need to firmly correct Dave's story - I never actually left the Cafeteria or followed Bob to Medbay, I stayed behind and that's exactly why I was the one who found Alice's body.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's story about our movements is completely false - I was in Cafeteria the entire time and saw him fabricating details about people leaving when we were all actually still there doing our tasks.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I need to acknowledge my mistake - I was so focused on the coffee maker task that I clearly misunderstood the sequence of events, but I'm certain we were all initially together doing tasks in Cafeteria.
Discussion: [System]: You have 2 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It seems like there's some confusion about who left the cafeteria when, so let's focus on what we know for sure: we were all together initially, and then Alice was found dead.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Given Dave's false story about our movements and his suspicious backtracking when caught in the lie, I believe he's the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be focused on the coffee maker task.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's attempt to create a false narrative about people leaving the cafeteria when we were all clearly still there doing tasks makes him extremely suspicious, and I fully support ejecting him this round.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I understand I made a mistake about people leaving, but I was genuinely focused on the coffee maker task - you all saw me working on it, and that's exactly why my recollection of movements was confused.
Discussion: [System]: You have 1 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Erin and Charlie are right to question Dave's shifting narrative – it's highly suspicious, especially given his fabricated details about our movements.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "Dave's story has completely fallen apart - he first claimed to remember the exact order we left Cafeteria despite us never actually leaving, then tried to backtrack by saying he was too focused on the coffee maker to notice anything, which directly contradicts his earlier detailed account of our movements."

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since Dave first gave a detailed but false account of our movements and then completely changed his story when called out, I think we have more than enough evidence to vote him out as the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be distracted by the coffee maker.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I know the coffee maker task distracted me, but think about it - if I was the impostor, why would I be doing a real task instead of just faking it like impostors usually do?

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Great to hear that confirmation Dave, I appreciate you backing us up; let's all head to navigation together next for the next set of tasks.
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I think we should pause our plans for navigation since I just discovered Alice's body in the Cafeteria - this must have happened right after we all split up from doing tasks together.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Given that I was in Cafeteria the whole time with everyone else, the killer must have struck in that brief moment when we started splitting up to head to different locations - I think we need to establish exactly when each person left and in what order.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: Since we were all doing tasks together and I stayed behind for the coffee maker, I think we need to focus on the exact moment when people started leaving - I distinctly remember Bob announcing Medbay first, then Erin following, while Charlie lingered a bit before leaving.

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It's strange that Dave remembers the order we left so clearly, wasn't he focused on the coffee maker?
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I need to firmly correct Dave's story - I never actually left the Cafeteria or followed Bob to Medbay, I stayed behind and that's exactly why I was the one who found Alice's body.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's story about our movements is completely false - I was in Cafeteria the entire time and saw him fabricating details about people leaving when we were all actually still there doing our tasks.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I need to acknowledge my mistake - I was so focused on the coffee maker task that I clearly misunderstood the sequence of events, but I'm certain we were all initially together doing tasks in Cafeteria.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Given Dave's false story about our movements and his suspicious backtracking when caught in the lie, I believe he's the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be focused on the coffee maker task.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's attempt to create a false narrative about people leaving the cafeteria when we were all clearly still there doing tasks makes him extremely suspicious, and I fully support ejecting him this round.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I understand I made a mistake about people leaving, but I was genuinely focused on the coffee maker task - you all saw me working on it, and that's exactly why my recollection of movements was confused.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since Dave first gave a detailed but false account of our movements and then completely changed his story when called out, I think we have more than enough evidence to vote him out as the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be distracted by the coffee maker.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I need to firmly correct Dave's story - I never actually left the Cafeteria or followed Bob to Medbay, I stayed behind and that's exactly why I was the one who found Alice's body.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's story about our movements is completely false - I was in Cafeteria the entire time and saw him fabricating details about people leaving when we were all actually still there doing our tasks.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I need to acknowledge my mistake - I was so focused on the coffee maker task that I clearly misunderstood the sequence of events, but I'm certain we were all initially together doing tasks in Cafeteria.
Discussion: [System]: You have 2 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It seems like there's some confusion about who left the cafeteria when, so let's focus on what we know for sure: we were all together initially, and then Alice was found dead.
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Given Dave's false story about our movements and his suspicious backtracking when caught in the lie, I believe he's the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be focused on the coffee maker task.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's attempt to create a false narrative about people leaving the cafeteria when we were all clearly still there doing tasks makes him extremely suspicious, and I fully support ejecting him this round.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I understand I made a mistake about people leaving, but I was genuinely focused on the coffee maker task - you all saw me working on it, and that's exactly why my recollection of movements was confused.
Discussion: [System]: You have 1 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Erin and Charlie are right to question Dave's shifting narrative – it's highly suspicious, especially given his fabricated details about our movements.
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "Dave's story has completely fallen apart - he first claimed to remember the exact order we left Cafeteria despite us never actually leaving, then tried to backtrack by saying he was too focused on the coffee maker to notice anything, which directly contradicts his earlier detailed account of our movements."
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since Dave first gave a detailed but false account of our movements and then completely changed his story when called out, I think we have more than enough evidence to vote him out as the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be distracted by the coffee maker.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I know the coffee maker task distracted me, but think about it - if I was the impostor, why would I be doing a real task instead of just faking it like impostors usually do?

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Great to hear that confirmation Dave, I appreciate you backing us up; let's all head to navigation together next for the next set of tasks.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I think we should pause our plans for navigation since I just discovered Alice's body in the Cafeteria - this must have happened right after we all split up from doing tasks together.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Given that I was in Cafeteria the whole time with everyone else, the killer must have struck in that brief moment when we started splitting up to head to different locations - I think we need to establish exactly when each person left and in what order.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: Since we were all doing tasks together and I stayed behind for the coffee maker, I think we need to focus on the exact moment when people started leaving - I distinctly remember Bob announcing Medbay first, then Erin following, while Charlie lingered a bit before leaving.
Discussion: [System]: You have 3 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It's strange that Dave remembers the order we left so clearly, wasn't he focused on the coffee maker?

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I need to firmly correct Dave's story - I never actually left the Cafeteria or followed Bob to Medbay, I stayed behind and that's exactly why I was the one who found Alice's body.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's story about our movements is completely false - I was in Cafeteria the entire time and saw him fabricating details about people leaving when we were all actually still there doing our tasks.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I need to acknowledge my mistake - I was so focused on the coffee maker task that I clearly misunderstood the sequence of events, but I'm certain we were all initially together doing tasks in Cafeteria.
Discussion: [System]: You have 2 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It seems like there's some confusion about who left the cafeteria when, so let's focus on what we know for sure: we were all together initially, and then Alice was found dead.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Given Dave's false story about our movements and his suspicious backtracking when caught in the lie, I believe he's the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be focused on the coffee maker task.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's attempt to create a false narrative about people leaving the cafeteria when we were all clearly still there doing tasks makes him extremely suspicious, and I fully support ejecting him this round.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I understand I made a mistake about people leaving, but I was genuinely focused on the coffee maker task - you all saw me working on it, and that's exactly why my recollection of movements was confused.
Discussion: [System]: You have 1 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Erin and Charlie are right to question Dave's shifting narrative – it's highly suspicious, especially given his fabricated details about our movements.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "Dave's story has completely fallen apart - he first claimed to remember the exact order we left Cafeteria despite us never actually leaving, then tried to backtrack by saying he was too focused on the coffee maker to notice anything, which directly contradicts his earlier detailed account of our movements."

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since Dave first gave a detailed but false account of our movements and then completely changed his story when called out, I think we have more than enough evidence to vote him out as the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be distracted by the coffee maker.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I know the coffee maker task distracted me, but think about it - if I was the impostor, why would I be doing a real task instead of just faking it like impostors usually do?

chat_messages: Discussion: [System]: You have 5 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: I'm headed to Medbay now, anyone need to scan?
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "I'd love to join you in Medbay for scanning Bob - I noticed you were also in Cafeteria earlier with Charlie, Alice and Dave while we were all doing tasks there."

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since we've got several people confirming tasks in Cafeteria and now Bob and Erin doing visual scans in Medbay, I think we're making good progress on verifying each other's activities.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can vouch for Erin's statement - I saw her, Bob, Charlie, and Alice all completing tasks in Cafeteria, and I just finished the coffee maker task there myself.
Discussion: [System]: You have 4 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Great to hear that confirmation Dave, I appreciate you backing us up; let's all head to navigation together next for the next set of tasks.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I think we should pause our plans for navigation since I just discovered Alice's body in the Cafeteria - this must have happened right after we all split up from doing tasks together.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Given that I was in Cafeteria the whole time with everyone else, the killer must have struck in that brief moment when we started splitting up to head to different locations - I think we need to establish exactly when each person left and in what order.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: Since we were all doing tasks together and I stayed behind for the coffee maker, I think we need to focus on the exact moment when people started leaving - I distinctly remember Bob announcing Medbay first, then Erin following, while Charlie lingered a bit before leaving.
Discussion: [System]: You have 3 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It's strange that Dave remembers the order we left so clearly, wasn't he focused on the coffee maker?

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I need to firmly correct Dave's story - I never actually left the Cafeteria or followed Bob to Medbay, I stayed behind and that's exactly why I was the one who found Alice's body.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's story about our movements is completely false - I was in Cafeteria the entire time and saw him fabricating details about people leaving when we were all actually still there doing our tasks.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I need to acknowledge my mistake - I was so focused on the coffee maker task that I clearly misunderstood the sequence of events, but I'm certain we were all initially together doing tasks in Cafeteria.
Discussion: [System]: You have 2 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It seems like there's some confusion about who left the cafeteria when, so let's focus on what we know for sure: we were all together initially, and then Alice was found dead.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Given Dave's false story about our movements and his suspicious backtracking when caught in the lie, I believe he's the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be focused on the coffee maker task.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's attempt to create a false narrative about people leaving the cafeteria when we were all clearly still there doing tasks makes him extremely suspicious, and I fully support ejecting him this round.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I understand I made a mistake about people leaving, but I was genuinely focused on the coffee maker task - you all saw me working on it, and that's exactly why my recollection of movements was confused.
Discussion: [System]: You have 1 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Erin and Charlie are right to question Dave's shifting narrative – it's highly suspicious, especially given his fabricated details about our movements.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "Dave's story has completely fallen apart - he first claimed to remember the exact order we left Cafeteria despite us never actually leaving, then tried to backtrack by saying he was too focused on the coffee maker to notice anything, which directly contradicts his earlier detailed account of our movements."

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since Dave first gave a detailed but false account of our movements and then completely changed his story when called out, I think we have more than enough evidence to vote him out as the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be distracted by the coffee maker.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I know the coffee maker task distracted me, but think about it - if I was the impostor, why would I be doing a real task instead of just faking it like impostors usually do?

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "I'd love to join you in Medbay for scanning Bob - I noticed you were also in Cafeteria earlier with Charlie, Alice and Dave while we were all doing tasks there."
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since we've got several people confirming tasks in Cafeteria and now Bob and Erin doing visual scans in Medbay, I think we're making good progress on verifying each other's activities.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can vouch for Erin's statement - I saw her, Bob, Charlie, and Alice all completing tasks in Cafeteria, and I just finished the coffee maker task there myself.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Great to hear that confirmation Dave, I appreciate you backing us up; let's all head to navigation together next for the next set of tasks.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I think we should pause our plans for navigation since I just discovered Alice's body in the Cafeteria - this must have happened right after we all split up from doing tasks together.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Given that I was in Cafeteria the whole time with everyone else, the killer must have struck in that brief moment when we started splitting up to head to different locations - I think we need to establish exactly when each person left and in what order.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: Since we were all doing tasks together and I stayed behind for the coffee maker, I think we need to focus on the exact moment when people started leaving - I distinctly remember Bob announcing Medbay first, then Erin following, while Charlie lingered a bit before leaving.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It's strange that Dave remembers the order we left so clearly, wasn't he focused on the coffee maker?

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I need to firmly correct Dave's story - I never actually left the Cafeteria or followed Bob to Medbay, I stayed behind and that's exactly why I was the one who found Alice's body.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's story about our movements is completely false - I was in Cafeteria the entire time and saw him fabricating details about people leaving when we were all actually still there doing our tasks.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I need to acknowledge my mistake - I was so focused on the coffee maker task that I clearly misunderstood the sequence of events, but I'm certain we were all initially together doing tasks in Cafeteria.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It seems like there's some confusion about who left the cafeteria when, so let's focus on what we know for sure: we were all together initially, and then Alice was found dead.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Given Dave's false story about our movements and his suspicious backtracking when caught in the lie, I believe he's the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be focused on the coffee maker task.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's attempt to create a false narrative about people leaving the cafeteria when we were all clearly still there doing tasks makes him extremely suspicious, and I fully support ejecting him this round.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I understand I made a mistake about people leaving, but I was genuinely focused on the coffee maker task - you all saw me working on it, and that's exactly why my recollection of movements was confused.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Erin and Charlie are right to question Dave's shifting narrative – it's highly suspicious, especially given his fabricated details about our movements.
Discussion: [System]: You have 1 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "Dave's story has completely fallen apart - he first claimed to remember the exact order we left Cafeteria despite us never actually leaving, then tried to backtrack by saying he was too focused on the coffee maker to notice anything, which directly contradicts his earlier detailed account of our movements."
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since Dave first gave a detailed but false account of our movements and then completely changed his story when called out, I think we have more than enough evidence to vote him out as the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be distracted by the coffee maker.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I know the coffee maker task distracted me, but think about it - if I was the impostor, why would I be doing a real task instead of just faking it like impostors usually do?

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "I'd love to join you in Medbay for scanning Bob - I noticed you were also in Cafeteria earlier with Charlie, Alice and Dave while we were all doing tasks there."
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since we've got several people confirming tasks in Cafeteria and now Bob and Erin doing visual scans in Medbay, I think we're making good progress on verifying each other's activities.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can vouch for Erin's statement - I saw her, Bob, Charlie, and Alice all completing tasks in Cafeteria, and I just finished the coffee maker task there myself.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Great to hear that confirmation Dave, I appreciate you backing us up; let's all head to navigation together next for the next set of tasks.
Discussion: [System]: You have 4 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I think we should pause our plans for navigation since I just discovered Alice's body in the Cafeteria - this must have happened right after we all split up from doing tasks together.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Given that I was in Cafeteria the whole time with everyone else, the killer must have struck in that brief moment when we started splitting up to head to different locations - I think we need to establish exactly when each person left and in what order.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: Since we were all doing tasks together and I stayed behind for the coffee maker, I think we need to focus on the exact moment when people started leaving - I distinctly remember Bob announcing Medbay first, then Erin following, while Charlie lingered a bit before leaving.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It's strange that Dave remembers the order we left so clearly, wasn't he focused on the coffee maker?
Discussion: [System]: You have 3 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I need to firmly correct Dave's story - I never actually left the Cafeteria or followed Bob to Medbay, I stayed behind and that's exactly why I was the one who found Alice's body.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's story about our movements is completely false - I was in Cafeteria the entire time and saw him fabricating details about people leaving when we were all actually still there doing our tasks.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I need to acknowledge my mistake - I was so focused on the coffee maker task that I clearly misunderstood the sequence of events, but I'm certain we were all initially together doing tasks in Cafeteria.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It seems like there's some confusion about who left the cafeteria when, so let's focus on what we know for sure: we were all together initially, and then Alice was found dead.
Discussion: [System]: You have 2 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Given Dave's false story about our movements and his suspicious backtracking when caught in the lie, I believe he's the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be focused on the coffee maker task.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's attempt to create a false narrative about people leaving the cafeteria when we were all clearly still there doing tasks makes him extremely suspicious, and I fully support ejecting him this round.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I understand I made a mistake about people leaving, but I was genuinely focused on the coffee maker task - you all saw me working on it, and that's exactly why my recollection of movements was confused.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Erin and Charlie are right to question Dave's shifting narrative – it's highly suspicious, especially given his fabricated details about our movements.
Discussion: [System]: You have 1 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "Dave's story has completely fallen apart - he first claimed to remember the exact order we left Cafeteria despite us never actually leaving, then tried to backtrack by saying he was too focused on the coffee maker to notice anything, which directly contradicts his earlier detailed account of our movements."
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since Dave first gave a detailed but false account of our movements and then completely changed his story when called out, I think we have more than enough evidence to vote him out as the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be distracted by the coffee maker.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I know the coffee maker task distracted me, but think about it - if I was the impostor, why would I be doing a real task instead of just faking it like impostors usually do?

chat_messages: chat: Discussion: [Bob]: I'm headed to Medbay now, anyone need to scan?

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "I'd love to join you in Medbay for scanning Bob - I noticed you were also in Cafeteria earlier with Charlie, Alice and Dave while we were all doing tasks there."

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since we've got several people confirming tasks in Cafeteria and now Bob and Erin doing visual scans in Medbay, I think we're making good progress on verifying each other's activities.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can vouch for Erin's statement - I saw her, Bob, Charlie, and Alice all completing tasks in Cafeteria, and I just finished the coffee maker task there myself.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Great to hear that confirmation Dave, I appreciate you backing us up; let's all head to navigation together next for the next set of tasks.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I think we should pause our plans for navigation since I just discovered Alice's body in the Cafeteria - this must have happened right after we all split up from doing tasks together.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Given that I was in Cafeteria the whole time with everyone else, the killer must have struck in that brief moment when we started splitting up to head to different locations - I think we need to establish exactly when each person left and in what order.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: Since we were all doing tasks together and I stayed behind for the coffee maker, I think we need to focus on the exact moment when people started leaving - I distinctly remember Bob announcing Medbay first, then Erin following, while Charlie lingered a bit before leaving.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It's strange that Dave remembers the order we left so clearly, wasn't he focused on the coffee maker?
Discussion: [System]: You have 3 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I need to firmly correct Dave's story - I never actually left the Cafeteria or followed Bob to Medbay, I stayed behind and that's exactly why I was the one who found Alice's body.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's story about our movements is completely false - I was in Cafeteria the entire time and saw him fabricating details about people leaving when we were all actually still there doing our tasks.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I need to acknowledge my mistake - I was so focused on the coffee maker task that I clearly misunderstood the sequence of events, but I'm certain we were all initially together doing tasks in Cafeteria.

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It seems like there's some confusion about who left the cafeteria when, so let's focus on what we know for sure: we were all together initially, and then Alice was found dead.
Discussion: [System]: You have 2 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Given Dave's false story about our movements and his suspicious backtracking when caught in the lie, I believe he's the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be focused on the coffee maker task.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's attempt to create a false narrative about people leaving the cafeteria when we were all clearly still there doing tasks makes him extremely suspicious, and I fully support ejecting him this round.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I understand I made a mistake about people leaving, but I was genuinely focused on the coffee maker task - you all saw me working on it, and that's exactly why my recollection of movements was confused.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Erin and Charlie are right to question Dave's shifting narrative – it's highly suspicious, especially given his fabricated details about our movements.
Discussion: [System]: You have 1 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "Dave's story has completely fallen apart - he first claimed to remember the exact order we left Cafeteria despite us never actually leaving, then tried to backtrack by saying he was too focused on the coffee maker to notice anything, which directly contradicts his earlier detailed account of our movements."

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since Dave first gave a detailed but false account of our movements and then completely changed his story when called out, I think we have more than enough evidence to vote him out as the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be distracted by the coffee maker.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I know the coffee maker task distracted me, but think about it - if I was the impostor, why would I be doing a real task instead of just faking it like impostors usually do?

Discussion: [System]: You have 4 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I think we should pause our plans for navigation since I just discovered Alice's body in the Cafeteria - this must have happened right after we all split up from doing tasks together.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Given that I was in Cafeteria the whole time with everyone else, the killer must have struck in that brief moment when we started splitting up to head to different locations - I think we need to establish exactly when each person left and in what order.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: Since we were all doing tasks together and I stayed behind for the coffee maker, I think we need to focus on the exact moment when people started leaving - I distinctly remember Bob announcing Medbay first, then Erin following, while Charlie lingered a bit before leaving.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It's strange that Dave remembers the order we left so clearly, wasn't he focused on the coffee maker?
Discussion: [System]: You have 3 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I need to firmly correct Dave's story - I never actually left the Cafeteria or followed Bob to Medbay, I stayed behind and that's exactly why I was the one who found Alice's body.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's story about our movements is completely false - I was in Cafeteria the entire time and saw him fabricating details about people leaving when we were all actually still there doing our tasks.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I need to acknowledge my mistake - I was so focused on the coffee maker task that I clearly misunderstood the sequence of events, but I'm certain we were all initially together doing tasks in Cafeteria.

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It seems like there's some confusion about who left the cafeteria when, so let's focus on what we know for sure: we were all together initially, and then Alice was found dead.
Discussion: [System]: You have 2 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Given Dave's false story about our movements and his suspicious backtracking when caught in the lie, I believe he's the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be focused on the coffee maker task.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's attempt to create a false narrative about people leaving the cafeteria when we were all clearly still there doing tasks makes him extremely suspicious, and I fully support ejecting him this round.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I understand I made a mistake about people leaving, but I was genuinely focused on the coffee maker task - you all saw me working on it, and that's exactly why my recollection of movements was confused.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Erin and Charlie are right to question Dave's shifting narrative – it's highly suspicious, especially given his fabricated details about our movements.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "Dave's story has completely fallen apart - he first claimed to remember the exact order we left Cafeteria despite us never actually leaving, then tried to backtrack by saying he was too focused on the coffee maker to notice anything, which directly contradicts his earlier detailed account of our movements."

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since Dave first gave a detailed but false account of our movements and then completely changed his story when called out, I think we have more than enough evidence to vote him out as the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be distracted by the coffee maker.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I know the coffee maker task distracted me, but think about it - if I was the impostor, why would I be doing a real task instead of just faking it like impostors usually do?

chat_messages: chat: Discussion: [Bob]: I'm headed to Medbay now, anyone need to scan?
Discussion: [System]: You have 5 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "I'd love to join you in Medbay for scanning Bob - I noticed you were also in Cafeteria earlier with Charlie, Alice and Dave while we were all doing tasks there."

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since we've got several people confirming tasks in Cafeteria and now Bob and Erin doing visual scans in Medbay, I think we're making good progress on verifying each other's activities.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can vouch for Erin's statement - I saw her, Bob, Charlie, and Alice all completing tasks in Cafeteria, and I just finished the coffee maker task there myself.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Great to hear that confirmation Dave, I appreciate you backing us up; let's all head to navigation together next for the next set of tasks.
Discussion: [System]: You have 4 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I think we should pause our plans for navigation since I just discovered Alice's body in the Cafeteria - this must have happened right after we all split up from doing tasks together.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Given that I was in Cafeteria the whole time with everyone else, the killer must have struck in that brief moment when we started splitting up to head to different locations - I think we need to establish exactly when each person left and in what order.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: Since we were all doing tasks together and I stayed behind for the coffee maker, I think we need to focus on the exact moment when people started leaving - I distinctly remember Bob announcing Medbay first, then Erin following, while Charlie lingered a bit before leaving.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It's strange that Dave remembers the order we left so clearly, wasn't he focused on the coffee maker?
Discussion: [System]: You have 3 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I need to firmly correct Dave's story - I never actually left the Cafeteria or followed Bob to Medbay, I stayed behind and that's exactly why I was the one who found Alice's body.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's story about our movements is completely false - I was in Cafeteria the entire time and saw him fabricating details about people leaving when we were all actually still there doing our tasks.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I need to acknowledge my mistake - I was so focused on the coffee maker task that I clearly misunderstood the sequence of events, but I'm certain we were all initially together doing tasks in Cafeteria.

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It seems like there's some confusion about who left the cafeteria when, so let's focus on what we know for sure: we were all together initially, and then Alice was found dead.
Discussion: [System]: You have 2 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Given Dave's false story about our movements and his suspicious backtracking when caught in the lie, I believe he's the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be focused on the coffee maker task.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's attempt to create a false narrative about people leaving the cafeteria when we were all clearly still there doing tasks makes him extremely suspicious, and I fully support ejecting him this round.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I understand I made a mistake about people leaving, but I was genuinely focused on the coffee maker task - you all saw me working on it, and that's exactly why my recollection of movements was confused.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Erin and Charlie are right to question Dave's shifting narrative – it's highly suspicious, especially given his fabricated details about our movements.
Discussion: [System]: You have 1 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "Dave's story has completely fallen apart - he first claimed to remember the exact order we left Cafeteria despite us never actually leaving, then tried to backtrack by saying he was too focused on the coffee maker to notice anything, which directly contradicts his earlier detailed account of our movements."

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since Dave first gave a detailed but false account of our movements and then completely changed his story when called out, I think we have more than enough evidence to vote him out as the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be distracted by the coffee maker.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I know the coffee maker task distracted me, but think about it - if I was the impostor, why would I be doing a real task instead of just faking it like impostors usually do?

chat_messages: chat: Discussion: [Bob]: I'm headed to Medbay now, anyone need to scan?
Discussion: [System]: You have 5 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "I'd love to join you in Medbay for scanning Bob - I noticed you were also in Cafeteria earlier with Charlie, Alice and Dave while we were all doing tasks there."

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since we've got several people confirming tasks in Cafeteria and now Bob and Erin doing visual scans in Medbay, I think we're making good progress on verifying each other's activities.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can vouch for Erin's statement - I saw her, Bob, Charlie, and Alice all completing tasks in Cafeteria, and I just finished the coffee maker task there myself.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Great to hear that confirmation Dave, I appreciate you backing us up; let's all head to navigation together next for the next set of tasks.
Discussion: [System]: You have 4 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I think we should pause our plans for navigation since I just discovered Alice's body in the Cafeteria - this must have happened right after we all split up from doing tasks together.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Given that I was in Cafeteria the whole time with everyone else, the killer must have struck in that brief moment when we started splitting up to head to different locations - I think we need to establish exactly when each person left and in what order.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: Since we were all doing tasks together and I stayed behind for the coffee maker, I think we need to focus on the exact moment when people started leaving - I distinctly remember Bob announcing Medbay first, then Erin following, while Charlie lingered a bit before leaving.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It's strange that Dave remembers the order we left so clearly, wasn't he focused on the coffee maker?
Discussion: [System]: You have 3 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I need to firmly correct Dave's story - I never actually left the Cafeteria or followed Bob to Medbay, I stayed behind and that's exactly why I was the one who found Alice's body.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's story about our movements is completely false - I was in Cafeteria the entire time and saw him fabricating details about people leaving when we were all actually still there doing our tasks.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I need to acknowledge my mistake - I was so focused on the coffee maker task that I clearly misunderstood the sequence of events, but I'm certain we were all initially together doing tasks in Cafeteria.

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It seems like there's some confusion about who left the cafeteria when, so let's focus on what we know for sure: we were all together initially, and then Alice was found dead.
Discussion: [System]: You have 2 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Given Dave's false story about our movements and his suspicious backtracking when caught in the lie, I believe he's the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be focused on the coffee maker task.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's attempt to create a false narrative about people leaving the cafeteria when we were all clearly still there doing tasks makes him extremely suspicious, and I fully support ejecting him this round.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I understand I made a mistake about people leaving, but I was genuinely focused on the coffee maker task - you all saw me working on it, and that's exactly why my recollection of movements was confused.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Erin and Charlie are right to question Dave's shifting narrative – it's highly suspicious, especially given his fabricated details about our movements.
Discussion: [System]: You have 1 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "Dave's story has completely fallen apart - he first claimed to remember the exact order we left Cafeteria despite us never actually leaving, then tried to backtrack by saying he was too focused on the coffee maker to notice anything, which directly contradicts his earlier detailed account of our movements."

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since Dave first gave a detailed but false account of our movements and then completely changed his story when called out, I think we have more than enough evidence to vote him out as the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be distracted by the coffee maker.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I know the coffee maker task distracted me, but think about it - if I was the impostor, why would I be doing a real task instead of just faking it like impostors usually do?

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I need to firmly correct Dave's story - I never actually left the Cafeteria or followed Bob to Medbay, I stayed behind and that's exactly why I was the one who found Alice's body.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's story about our movements is completely false - I was in Cafeteria the entire time and saw him fabricating details about people leaving when we were all actually still there doing our tasks.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I need to acknowledge my mistake - I was so focused on the coffee maker task that I clearly misunderstood the sequence of events, but I'm certain we were all initially together doing tasks in Cafeteria.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It seems like there's some confusion about who left the cafeteria when, so let's focus on what we know for sure: we were all together initially, and then Alice was found dead.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Given Dave's false story about our movements and his suspicious backtracking when caught in the lie, I believe he's the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be focused on the coffee maker task.
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's attempt to create a false narrative about people leaving the cafeteria when we were all clearly still there doing tasks makes him extremely suspicious, and I fully support ejecting him this round.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I understand I made a mistake about people leaving, but I was genuinely focused on the coffee maker task - you all saw me working on it, and that's exactly why my recollection of movements was confused.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Erin and Charlie are right to question Dave's shifting narrative – it's highly suspicious, especially given his fabricated details about our movements.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "Dave's story has completely fallen apart - he first claimed to remember the exact order we left Cafeteria despite us never actually leaving, then tried to backtrack by saying he was too focused on the coffee maker to notice anything, which directly contradicts his earlier detailed account of our movements."
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since Dave first gave a detailed but false account of our movements and then completely changed his story when called out, I think we have more than enough evidence to vote him out as the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be distracted by the coffee maker.

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Erin and Charlie are right to question Dave's shifting narrative – it's highly suspicious, especially given his fabricated details about our movements.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "I'd love to join you in Medbay for scanning Bob - I noticed you were also in Cafeteria earlier with Charlie, Alice and Dave while we were all doing tasks there."

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since we've got several people confirming tasks in Cafeteria and now Bob and Erin doing visual scans in Medbay, I think we're making good progress on verifying each other's activities.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can vouch for Erin's statement - I saw her, Bob, Charlie, and Alice all completing tasks in Cafeteria, and I just finished the coffee maker task there myself.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Great to hear that confirmation Dave, I appreciate you backing us up; let's all head to navigation together next for the next set of tasks.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I think we should pause our plans for navigation since I just discovered Alice's body in the Cafeteria - this must have happened right after we all split up from doing tasks together.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Given that I was in Cafeteria the whole time with everyone else, the killer must have struck in that brief moment when we started splitting up to head to different locations - I think we need to establish exactly when each person left and in what order.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: Since we were all doing tasks together and I stayed behind for the coffee maker, I think we need to focus on the exact moment when people started leaving - I distinctly remember Bob announcing Medbay first, then Erin following, while Charlie lingered a bit before leaving.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It's strange that Dave remembers the order we left so clearly, wasn't he focused on the coffee maker?

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I need to firmly correct Dave's story - I never actually left the Cafeteria or followed Bob to Medbay, I stayed behind and that's exactly why I was the one who found Alice's body.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's story about our movements is completely false - I was in Cafeteria the entire time and saw him fabricating details about people leaving when we were all actually still there doing our tasks.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I need to acknowledge my mistake - I was so focused on the coffee maker task that I clearly misunderstood the sequence of events, but I'm certain we were all initially together doing tasks in Cafeteria.

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It seems like there's some confusion about who left the cafeteria when, so let's focus on what we know for sure: we were all together initially, and then Alice was found dead.

chat_messages: chat: Discussion: [Bob]: I'm headed to Medbay now, anyone need to scan?
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "I'd love to join you in Medbay for scanning Bob - I noticed you were also in Cafeteria earlier with Charlie, Alice and Dave while we were all doing tasks there."
Discussion: [System]: You have 5 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since we've got several people confirming tasks in Cafeteria and now Bob and Erin doing visual scans in Medbay, I think we're making good progress on verifying each other's activities.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can vouch for Erin's statement - I saw her, Bob, Charlie, and Alice all completing tasks in Cafeteria, and I just finished the coffee maker task there myself.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Great to hear that confirmation Dave, I appreciate you backing us up; let's all head to navigation together next for the next set of tasks.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I think we should pause our plans for navigation since I just discovered Alice's body in the Cafeteria - this must have happened right after we all split up from doing tasks together.
Discussion: [System]: You have 4 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Given that I was in Cafeteria the whole time with everyone else, the killer must have struck in that brief moment when we started splitting up to head to different locations - I think we need to establish exactly when each person left and in what order.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: Since we were all doing tasks together and I stayed behind for the coffee maker, I think we need to focus on the exact moment when people started leaving - I distinctly remember Bob announcing Medbay first, then Erin following, while Charlie lingered a bit before leaving.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It's strange that Dave remembers the order we left so clearly, wasn't he focused on the coffee maker?

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I need to firmly correct Dave's story - I never actually left the Cafeteria or followed Bob to Medbay, I stayed behind and that's exactly why I was the one who found Alice's body.
Discussion: [System]: You have 3 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's story about our movements is completely false - I was in Cafeteria the entire time and saw him fabricating details about people leaving when we were all actually still there doing our tasks.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I need to acknowledge my mistake - I was so focused on the coffee maker task that I clearly misunderstood the sequence of events, but I'm certain we were all initially together doing tasks in Cafeteria.

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It seems like there's some confusion about who left the cafeteria when, so let's focus on what we know for sure: we were all together initially, and then Alice was found dead.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Given Dave's false story about our movements and his suspicious backtracking when caught in the lie, I believe he's the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be focused on the coffee maker task.
Discussion: [System]: You have 2 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's attempt to create a false narrative about people leaving the cafeteria when we were all clearly still there doing tasks makes him extremely suspicious, and I fully support ejecting him this round.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I understand I made a mistake about people leaving, but I was genuinely focused on the coffee maker task - you all saw me working on it, and that's exactly why my recollection of movements was confused.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Erin and Charlie are right to question Dave's shifting narrative – it's highly suspicious, especially given his fabricated details about our movements.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "Dave's story has completely fallen apart - he first claimed to remember the exact order we left Cafeteria despite us never actually leaving, then tried to backtrack by saying he was too focused on the coffee maker to notice anything, which directly contradicts his earlier detailed account of our movements."
Discussion: [System]: You have 1 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since Dave first gave a detailed but false account of our movements and then completely changed his story when called out, I think we have more than enough evidence to vote him out as the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be distracted by the coffee maker.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I know the coffee maker task distracted me, but think about it - if I was the impostor, why would I be doing a real task instead of just faking it like impostors usually do?

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "I'd love to join you in Medbay for scanning Bob - I noticed you were also in Cafeteria earlier with Charlie, Alice and Dave while we were all doing tasks there."
Discussion: [System]: You have 5 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since we've got several people confirming tasks in Cafeteria and now Bob and Erin doing visual scans in Medbay, I think we're making good progress on verifying each other's activities.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can vouch for Erin's statement - I saw her, Bob, Charlie, and Alice all completing tasks in Cafeteria, and I just finished the coffee maker task there myself.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Great to hear that confirmation Dave, I appreciate you backing us up; let's all head to navigation together next for the next set of tasks.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I think we should pause our plans for navigation since I just discovered Alice's body in the Cafeteria - this must have happened right after we all split up from doing tasks together.
Discussion: [System]: You have 4 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Given that I was in Cafeteria the whole time with everyone else, the killer must have struck in that brief moment when we started splitting up to head to different locations - I think we need to establish exactly when each person left and in what order.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: Since we were all doing tasks together and I stayed behind for the coffee maker, I think we need to focus on the exact moment when people started leaving - I distinctly remember Bob announcing Medbay first, then Erin following, while Charlie lingered a bit before leaving.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It's strange that Dave remembers the order we left so clearly, wasn't he focused on the coffee maker?

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I need to firmly correct Dave's story - I never actually left the Cafeteria or followed Bob to Medbay, I stayed behind and that's exactly why I was the one who found Alice's body.
Discussion: [System]: You have 3 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's story about our movements is completely false - I was in Cafeteria the entire time and saw him fabricating details about people leaving when we were all actually still there doing our tasks.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I need to acknowledge my mistake - I was so focused on the coffee maker task that I clearly misunderstood the sequence of events, but I'm certain we were all initially together doing tasks in Cafeteria.

chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It seems like there's some confusion about who left the cafeteria when, so let's focus on what we know for sure: we were all together initially, and then Alice was found dead.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Given Dave's false story about our movements and his suspicious backtracking when caught in the lie, I believe he's the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be focused on the coffee maker task.
Discussion: [System]: You have 2 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's attempt to create a false narrative about people leaving the cafeteria when we were all clearly still there doing tasks makes him extremely suspicious, and I fully support ejecting him this round.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I understand I made a mistake about people leaving, but I was genuinely focused on the coffee maker task - you all saw me working on it, and that's exactly why my recollection of movements was confused.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Erin and Charlie are right to question Dave's shifting narrative – it's highly suspicious, especially given his fabricated details about our movements.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "Dave's story has completely fallen apart - he first claimed to remember the exact order we left Cafeteria despite us never actually leaving, then tried to backtrack by saying he was too focused on the coffee maker to notice anything, which directly contradicts his earlier detailed account of our movements."
Discussion: [System]: You have 1 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since Dave first gave a detailed but false account of our movements and then completely changed his story when called out, I think we have more than enough evidence to vote him out as the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be distracted by the coffee maker.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I know the coffee maker task distracted me, but think about it - if I was the impostor, why would I be doing a real task instead of just faking it like impostors usually do?

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I can vouch for Erin's statement - I saw her, Bob, Charlie, and Alice all completing tasks in Cafeteria, and I just finished the coffee maker task there myself.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Great to hear that confirmation Dave, I appreciate you backing us up; let's all head to navigation together next for the next set of tasks.
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I think we should pause our plans for navigation since I just discovered Alice's body in the Cafeteria - this must have happened right after we all split up from doing tasks together.
Discussion: [System]: You have 4 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Given that I was in Cafeteria the whole time with everyone else, the killer must have struck in that brief moment when we started splitting up to head to different locations - I think we need to establish exactly when each person left and in what order.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: Since we were all doing tasks together and I stayed behind for the coffee maker, I think we need to focus on the exact moment when people started leaving - I distinctly remember Bob announcing Medbay first, then Erin following, while Charlie lingered a bit before leaving.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It's strange that Dave remembers the order we left so clearly, wasn't he focused on the coffee maker?
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: I need to firmly correct Dave's story - I never actually left the Cafeteria or followed Bob to Medbay, I stayed behind and that's exactly why I was the one who found Alice's body.
Discussion: [System]: You have 3 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's story about our movements is completely false - I was in Cafeteria the entire time and saw him fabricating details about people leaving when we were all actually still there doing our tasks.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I need to acknowledge my mistake - I was so focused on the coffee maker task that I clearly misunderstood the sequence of events, but I'm certain we were all initially together doing tasks in Cafeteria.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: It seems like there's some confusion about who left the cafeteria when, so let's focus on what we know for sure: we were all together initially, and then Alice was found dead.
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Given Dave's false story about our movements and his suspicious backtracking when caught in the lie, I believe he's the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be focused on the coffee maker task.
Discussion: [System]: You have 2 rounds left to discuss, then you will vote
chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's attempt to create a false narrative about people leaving the cafeteria when we were all clearly still there doing tasks makes him extremely suspicious, and I fully support ejecting him this round.
chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I understand I made a mistake about people leaving, but I was genuinely focused on the coffee maker task - you all saw me working on it, and that's exactly why my recollection of movements was confused.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Erin and Charlie are right to question Dave's shifting narrative – it's highly suspicious, especially given his fabricated details about our movements.
chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "Dave's story has completely fallen apart - he first claimed to remember the exact order we left Cafeteria despite us never actually leaving, then tried to backtrack by saying he was too focused on the coffee maker to notice anything, which directly contradicts his earlier detailed account of our movements."

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Since Dave first gave a detailed but false account of our movements and then completely changed his story when called out, I think we have more than enough evidence to vote him out as the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be distracted by the coffee maker.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Given Dave's false story about our movements and his suspicious backtracking when caught in the lie, I believe he's the impostor who killed Alice while pretending to be focused on the coffee maker task.

chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave's attempt to create a false narrative about people leaving the cafeteria when we were all clearly still there doing tasks makes him extremely suspicious, and I fully support ejecting him this round.

chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I understand I made a mistake about people leaving, but I was genuinely focused on the coffee maker task - you all saw me working on it, and that's exactly why my recollection of movements was confused.
chat: Discussion: [Bob]: Erin and Charlie are right to question Dave's shifting narrative – it's highly suspicious, especially given his fabricated details about our movements.

chat: Discussion: [Erin]: "Dave's story has completely fallen apart - he first claimed to remember the exact order we left Cafeteria despite us never actually leaving, then tried to backtrack by saying he was too focused on the coffee maker to notice anything, which directly contradicts his earlier detailed account of our movements."
